explanation: Agent A is correct. In a build where sizeof(off_t) >= sizeof(uint64_t) the subexpression (sizeof(off_t) < sizeof(uint64_t)) is a compile-time constant false, so the whole && expression used as the if controlling expression is invariant (always false). MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 forbids invariant controlling expressions (no applicable exception applies here), so that if statement violates the rule in that configuration. Note that the violation is configuration-dependent: when sizeof(off_t) < sizeof(uint64_t) the expression is not invariant and no violation arises. To fix this for MISRA compliance, remove the dead test for that configuration (e.g. resolve at configuration time and compile out the branch) or restructure so the controlling expression is not a compile-time invariant (for example by guarding with an appropriate configuration macro determined by the build system).
